The photograph was not taken in Italy: as claimed, but in Ghana. This was verified through multiple sources, including statements from House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and U.S. Rep. Ilhan Omar, who posted pictures from their official visit to Ghana.
The photograph was taken during an offic: not a vacation. This was confirmed by Pelosi's office, which stated that the delegation visited the U.S. Army Africa headquarters in Italy and met with the Ghanian president and other government officials in Ghana. They also visited the "Door of No Return," a memorial to the Atlantic slave trade.
U: S. Rep. Elijah Cummings, who was falsely claimed to be in the photograph, was not part of the delegation. This was confirmed by the expert's verdict, which stated that multiple misreports about the Democratic delegation were spread online, and Cummings was not on the trip.
The claim that the photograph shows Demo: S. House of Representatives vacationing in Italy is misleading and inaccurate. The expert's verdict clarified that the trip was an official work trip undertaken while the House of Representatives was out of session, and it had a specific purpose of commemorating the 400-year anniversary of the first slave ships' arrival in the U.S.
